body:
I have this simple `demo_cptime_env.pyx`:
```
IF MY_FLAG:
    print("MY_FLAG works!")
```

setup.py like this:
```
from setuptools import setup
from Cython.Distutils.extension import Extension
from Cython.Build import cythonize
from Cython.Distutils import build_ext

extensions = [
    Extension(
        "demo_cptime_env", ["demo_cptime_env.pyx"],
        language="c",
        cython_compile_time_env=dict(MY_FLAG=True),
    )
]


if __name__ == '__main__':
   print("cython_compile_time_env", extensions[0].cython_compile_time_env)
    _exts = cythonize(
        extensions,
    )
    setup(
        cmdclass = {'build_ext': build_ext},
        ext_modules = _exts,
    )
```
However, though the cython_compile_time_env got correctly processed by the Extension, but  it get lost in create_extension_list() inside the cythonize(). 
Thus we have result:
```
cython_compile_time_env {'MY_FLAG': True}
Compiling demo_cptime_env.pyx because it changed.
[1/1] Cythonizing demo_cptime_env.pyx

Error compiling Cython file:
------------------------------------------------------------
...
IF MY_FLAG:
  ^
------------------------------------------------------------

demo_cptime_env.pyx:1:3: Compile-time name 'MY_FLAG' not defined

```
It only works if we put `compile_time_env=dict(MY_FLAG=True)` in cythonize kwargs
title: cython_compile_time_env has no effect at all
